newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares shrug off US payroll jump.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares shrug off US payroll jump.

text.p: Danish share prices closed at a new record high on Friday despite unexpectedly high U.S. payroll data that damped other European bourses.
The KFX top-20 index rose 1.01 point to 139.69, in overall bourse turnover of 2.045 billion crowns.
Dealers said that its course on Monday would be determined by developments later Friday on Wall Street.
"If the Dow Jones falls more than 150 points it will effect Danish prices, but a fall of 70-80 points is already built into the Copenhagen market," a dealer said.
The KFX March future was untraded at 139.60. Gains and losses were moderate across the top 20.
Among the best performers was oil and shipping group A.P.Moeller's DS Svendborg share, rising 6,000 crowns -- 2.5 percent -- to 246,500 on high oil prices and the firm dollar.
BG Bank rose six crowns to 300 crowns, Den Danske Bank gained seven crowns to close at 483 and Unidanmark ended the day at 331, a four-crown rise.
